author: amit0617
content: hello there, I guess you are the supposed mentor for creating a rest wrapper around JSON-RPCs. I am quite familiar with creating APIs in javascript and python languages. And very open to learn other languages for their implementation. Just wanted to know little more details like what frameworks or middlewares we will be choosing for doing that.

author: amit0617
content: myself particularly also wanted to know if there is already some work or repository existing or it is waiting for contributors to get started.

author: amit0617
content: What I have [explored till now](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/) it looks quite easy. I hope I am not misunderstanding but it is just creating path for methods, add params to them using `?`,`&` and create an json object reading that to call RPC.

author: amit0617
content: and just forward the received response to user

author: amit0617
content: If there isn't any work already existing on it then I would like to do this with golang. Just started learning it and would like to take out some benefits for myself while contributing for it.

author: amit0617
content: Also I can see more possible implementations for it after REST, like graphQL etc.

author: lightclient
content:
Hello! Yes I am the mentor for that project. I think it is up to you, what you're comfortable and/or what you are interested in learning. My personal preference would be either go or rust as they're both performant and I know them relatively well.

A lot of the work will be honing in a spec though, which should be done using OpenAPI. Ideally it will look and feel somewhat similar to the beacon REST api. It might be best if you try to spec out a couple different methods and then ping me to review so we can talk more about the design and make sure we're on the same page

author: lightclient
content: i might recommend looking into specing getters for things like `eth_getBlockBy*`, `eth_call`, and maybe `eth_getBalance` - this would be a reasonable beadth of different methods

author: joshd4078
content: Paris Meet Up Info

author: amit0617
content: i might recommend looking into specing

author: manav2401
content:
Hello everyone, I am highly interested in working one of the below 2 projects during the fellowship. I have spent quite a good amount of time in the last few days reading about both of them from various articles and ethresearch posts to gain context and clarity over the topics. 

1. eBPS Design and Prototyping - As the broad description of the task involves a lot of things (starting from reviewing the literature to implementing in Prysm), it would be great if someone from the Prysm team (or any consensus research/client team or RIG team) could help me with some next steps. 

2. Single slot finality - I believe that this project is quite research heavy as of now and also has some dependencies (like validator economics and aggregation protocols like horn). Hence, I am not sure what would be an ideal expectation from such project as it can be to continue the research, or build PoC for some consensus client or something else. It would be great if someone from the consensus research/client team can guide me on it. 

Thanks!
